meanings.definition: Fully developed in body or mind, as a person.
meanings.sent1: She is the maturest student in our class.
meanings.sent2: The oak tree looked the maturest in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The maturest squirrel in the park always finds the best acorns.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were the maturest fruit of his years of experience.
meanings.sent5: The maturest rose in the garden bloomed with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: Having reached the most advanced stage in a process.
meanings.sent1: This is the maturest stage of the project.
meanings.sent2: The cake was at its maturest flavor after baking for an hour.
meanings.sent3: The maturest level of excitement was reached when the surprise was revealed.
meanings.sent4: Her decision-making skills were at their maturest during the crisis.
meanings.sent5: The maturest point of the story left everyone in awe.

meanings.definition: To become fully developed physically or mentally.
meanings.sent1: He maturest slowly but steadily over the years.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar will maturest into a butterfly soon.
meanings.sent3: I hope to maturest into a wise old owl one day.
meanings.sent4: The young sapling will maturest into a strong oak tree.
meanings.sent5: With time, she will maturest into a confident leader.
